ginCode.title: The Gin Code Schema
ginCode.description: The gin code number is composed of the first five digits of the PBI. The first two digits denote the Classing Office, and the last three digits identify the gin. The local Classing Office assigns this code number.

ginBale.title: The Gin Bale Schema
ginBale.description: The gin bale number is composed of the last seven-digits of the PBI and is assigned by the gin.

dateClassed.title: The Date Classed Schema
dateClassed.description: This is the date the classification data for the bale was released by the Classing Office.

baleModule.title: The Bale Module Schema
baleModule.description: This one-digit code indicates whether the sample was outturned as a single bale or as a bale that was module/trailer averaged.

moduleTrailerNumber.title: The Module Trailer Number Schema
moduleTrailerNumber.description: This five-digit number identifies the module/trailer number assigned at the gin.

numberBales.title: The Number Bales Schema
numberBales.description: This two-digit number identifies the number of bales in the module/trailer that were released with the module average calculations.

officialColorGrade.title: The Official Color Grade Schema
officialColorGrade.description: The official Upland or Pima color grade that appears on the classification record is determined by instrument based measurements of Rd and +b. Color refers to the gradations of grayness and yellowness in the cotton.

length.title: The Length Schema
length.description: Staple length measured in 32nds of an inch.

lengthIn100.title: The Length in 100 Schema
lengthIn100.description: Staple length measured in 100ths of an inch.

micronaire.title: The Micronaire Schema
micronaire.description: Micronaire is a measure of the cotton’s fineness and is reported to the nearest tenth.

strength.title: The Strength Schema
strength.description: The force in grams required to break a bundle of fibers one tex unit in size.

leafGrade.title: The Leaf Grade Schema
leafGrade.description: Leaf refers to particles of the cotton plant’s leaf which remain in the lint after the ginning process.

extraneousMatter.title: The Extraneous Matter Schema
extraneousMatter.description: Extraneous matter is any substance in the cotton other than fiber or leaf.

remarks.title: The Remarks Schema
remarks.description: The instrument assigns the remarks code 75 where applicable. Classers identify other special conditions that may cause processing problems and lower yarn quality.

instrumetColorGrade.title: The Instrumet Color Grade Schema
instrumetColorGrade.description: The official Upland or Pima color grade that appears on the classification record is determined by instrument based measurements of Rd and +b. Color refers to the gradations of grayness and yellowness in the cotton.

colorRd.title: The Color RD Schema
colorRd.description: Grayness indicates how light or dark the sample is.

colorPlusB.title: The Color Plus B Schema
colorPlusB.description: Yellowness indicates how much yellow color is in the sample.

trashPercentArea.title: The Trash Percent Area Schema
trashPercentArea.description: The two-digit trash percent area reported on the classification record is the percent of the sample surface covered by trash particles as determined by the instrument to the nearest tenth. Trash particles include extraneous matter such as grass, bark, etc., but these particles cannot be distinguished one from another by this measurement.

lengthUniformityIndex.title: The Length Uniformity Index Schema
lengthUniformityIndex.description: Length uniformity index is a three-digit number that is a measure of the degree of uniformity of the fibers in a sample to the nearest tenth.

uplandOrPima.title: The Upland or Pima Schema
uplandOrPima.description: This one-digit code indicates whether the sample is Upland or American Pima.

recordStatus.title: The Record Status Schema
recordStatus.description: This one digit code indicates whether or not the manual classing information has been corrected.

cCCLoan Premium.title: The CCC Loan Premium Schema
cCCLoan Premium.description: This five-digit code gives the CCC loan premium and discount points for Upland cotton. The physical loan price for Pima cotton is shown in cents per pound.
